page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY_WITHERNWICK
page.content:
Local History items about Withernwick.
The name Withernwick comes from the words {white thorn wick.}Withernwick is mentioned in the Domesday Book as { {Widfornewick.}Over the centuries the name changed to {Whit thornwick}and then to {Withornwick} and finally to { {Withernwick. During the reign of George 111 the village was divided into two separate parts _ North End and South End (this is still marked on the map today). There were 18 farmhouses and 50 cottages in the village at this time. In the 1840's there were about the same number of people living in the village as there are in 1985 _ 440.
